DOC.brief_summary: Compare impact use rapid maxillary expanders masticatory muscle activity ( Masseter Anterior Temporalis muscle ) cross-bite side non-cross-bite side preadolescent orthodontic patient expansion one month completion treatment period use surface electromyography device .
DOC.brief_title: Electromyography Study Comparing Impact Using Rapid Maxillary Expander Muscle Activity Crossbite Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Compare impact use rapid maxillary expanders masticatory muscle activity ( Masseter Anterior Temporalis muscle ) cross-bite side non-cross-bite side preadolescent orthodontic patient expansion one month completion treatment period . Two channel surface Electromyography sEMG ( BioRadio ) , position record activity anterior temporal ( AT ) masseter ( MM ) muscle three different status : - Rest → patient instruct bite his/her teeth . - Clench → patient instruct make maximum voluntary clench cotton roll position around first molar , 5 sec `` cotton clench '' , maximum voluntary clench without interposed roll 5 sec `` `` clench '' . * This procedure follow Sforza et al . protocol . - During function `` mastication '' → The patient instruct chew chew gum 20 sec ( 20 continuous masticatory cycle ) . Examination frequency : The patient examine two time follow : Test 1 : Immediately rapid maxillary expanders cementation , Test 2 : 5 month later ( 1 month retention phase ) . procedure do 25 patient ( control group )
DOC.criteria: 1 . Unilateral posterior crossbite . 2 . Patients erupt permanent maxillary mandibular first molars . 3 . Will treat rapid maxillary expanders , ( appliance planning wear approximately 5 month ) . 4 . Age range 9 12 . 5 . Males female . 1 . History functional appliance treatment . 2 . Oral , systemic disease syndrome . 3 . Patients medication . 6 . Patients symptoms Temporomandibular disorder . 4 . Neuropathic condition . 5 . Open deepbite .
